emuInput.TitMainTitle: Bertha Gloster, Ralph Gloster, and Gladys Mason standing in front of polling place with Silas Knox for Constable poster, during 1955 primary elections, Bedford Dwellings
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 21, 1955, pg. 17 reads: "Not Happy Nor Worried - Ralph Gloster listens to chatter between his wife, Bertha, on the left, and Gladys Mason, on the right, as they discuss the turnout in the first district on Tuesday. Gloster, candidate for alderman, pledged to carry Thomas J. Smith, which he did, and was contented with a token vote for himself.  His campaigning for the day was limited to his own district-and his promise.  -Harris Photo."
